content.description: The rate, in calories per minute, at which a person using an exercise machine burns calories is modeled by the function \(f\). In the figure above, \(f\left(t\right)=-\frac{1}{4}t^3+\frac{3}{2}t^2+1\) for \(0\le t\le4\) and \(f\) is piecewise linear for \(4\le t\le24\).
content.question: For the time interval \(0\le t\le24\), at what time \(t\) is \(f\) increasing at its greatest rate? Show the reasoning that supports your answer.

frqParts.text: For the time interval \(0\le t\le24\), at what time \(t\) is \(f\) increasing at its greatest rate? Show the reasoning that supports your answer.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
